meanings.definition: The structure of an aircraft, including the fuselage, wings, and control surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The airframe of the plane holds the wings and fuselage together.
meanings.sent2: The engineers inspected the airframe for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the airframe was a great place to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The airframe of the aircraft is like the skeleton that supports its body.
meanings.sent5: The shiny metal of the airframe gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The framework or structure of a vehicle or machine that is designed to be supported by air.
meanings.sent1: The helicopter's airframe was made of lightweight materials for better maneuverability.
meanings.sent2: The mechanics were trained to repair any damage to the airframe of the spacecraft.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the swing set was an airframe ready to take them on an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The airframe of the drone allowed it to soar gracefully through the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy airframe of the glider ensured a smooth flight experience for the pilot.
